cards.flavor_text: [i]The wandering god Unell is seen as an exemplary hero, moving from adventure to adventure without ever slowing. His followers likewise seek out new glories and greater triumphs.[/i]
[i]Luth, god of craftwork and culture, is an ill-tempered but creative being, never content with his work. Those who invoke him are thus inspired never to rest on their own laurels either.[/i]
[i]Capal Dú, the black horse, is king of the gods not by respect but through fear. His name is not uttered lightly and he is less worshipped than appeased throughout Ulaith.[/i]

[i]Annan, the voyager, god of seas and of the Otherworld, is an ephemeral trickster, delighting in the unknowable nature of his twin realms. Those who call on him do so to ward against his own caprices as much as any other fate.[/i]

[i]Rigann, god of death and fate, measures the life of each of soul on Ulaith. She is a fickle master, and though many swear fealty to her, it is her great delight to trip warriors up in conflicting oaths and broken promises.[/i]

As Preservation Jar enters the battlefield, choose a creature card name.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can’t be activated unless they’re mana abilities.
Permanents with the chosen name can’t attack or block.

Other creatures you control have “{X}{UR}: Diverge X/X.” [i](If that creature isn’t a Mutant, its base power and toughness become X/X and it becomes a Mutant in addition to its other types. Diverge only as a sorcery.)[/i]

{GU}, {T}, Sacrifice a token: Search your library for a creature card with combined power and toughness equal to 1 plus the sacrificed token’s combined power and toughness, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. Activate only as a sorcery.
Whenever you sacrifice a nontoken creature, you may exile it. If you do, create a token that’s a copy of that creature, except it’s 2/2.

{W}{U}, {T}: Choose target creature, then choose one –
• Until end of turn, that creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.
• Exile that creature, then return it to the battlefield under its owner’s control.

When Sush Kur, Sporebreeder enters the battlefield, put a spore counter on each other creature you control.
{R}{G}, Sacrifice a creature with a spore counter on it: Create X 1/1 green Fungus Insect Mutant creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature’s power. Activate only as a sorcery.

When Transhumanism enters the battlefield, each player may put a +1/+1 counter on up to one creature.
Each creature can’t attack unless its power or toughness is higher than its base power or toughness.

Enchant creature or planeswalker
When Stolen Spark enters the battlefield, if enchanted permanent isn’t a planeswalker, put three loyalty counters on it and it becomes a legendary planeswalker with “[+1]: Scry 1.” and “[-3]: Draw a card.” [i](It’s no longer a creature.)[/i]
Put all Human cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.
Exile your graveyard. Until end of turn, you may cast spells from among the exiled cards. When you cast a spell this way, it deals damage to you equal to the number of spells you’ve cast this turn.
Double the power of each of up to X target creatures until end of turn. If seven or more green mana was spent to cast this spell, those creatures gain trample until end of turn.

When It From Beyond enters the battlefield, exile all cards from graveyards.
Spells you cast cost {W} less to cast if you own a white card in exile. The same is true for {U} and blue, {B} and black, {R} and red, and {G} and green.
{T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Choose target card in your graveyard. You may cast that card this turn if its mana value is less than or equal to the exiled card’s.

As Udim, Human Plus enters the battlefield, you may pay any amount of life.
Udim, Human Plus enters the battlefield tapped with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the life paid.

Whenever a source you control deals damage to an opponent, put a +1/+1 counter on Nemesis, Imperfect Form.
Remove three +1/+1 counters from Nemesis: Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards. Instant and sorcery spells you cast this way have lifelink.
